document_data.name: Dragon's Rest
document_data.architecture: Stone pillars and hollowed-out stone cells
document_data.mainbody:
'''Dragon's Rest''' was a monastery dedicated to [[Bahamut]], the benevolent god of [[good]] [[dragon]]kind. It had a long and storied history, but remained in use by followers of the Platinum Dragon as of the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Welcome to Dragon's Rest. May Bahamut's guidance lead you to whatever you seek.|Elder Runara.}}
document_data.Location: The monastery was built atop the cliffs along the northern stretch of [[Stormwreck Isle]], a small landmass in the [[Sea of Swords]] just off the [[Sword Coast]].
document_data.Structure:
It was constructed as a large, open-air temple set high atop the Stormwreck, along with several underground chambers carved within the cliff face overlooking the sea below. 

A switchback pathway and ascending rocky stairs connected the various underground chambers, leading up to Bahamut's temple.

Interior.Atmosphere: Visitors of Dragon's Rest were overcome with feelings of peace and tranquility.

document_data.Activities: The monastery was a site to which pilgrims traveled, in order to seek serenity, greater wisdom, and guidance in their life's path.
document_data.Defenses: Dragon's Rest was protected by potent warding magic.
document_data.Inhabitants:
As of the late 15{{th}} century, Bahamut's monastery was inhabited by a band of semi-intelligent, non-violent [[kobold]]s who devoted themselves to the tenets of Bahamut's faith. Notable among them were [[Agga]], [[Blepp]], [[Myla]], and [[Zark]], among others. Two humans took up residence within the temple: [[Tarak]] an enthusiastic botanist, and [[Varnoth Wender|Varnoth]], the retired leader of the [[Azure Wolves]] mercenary company.

The monastery was led by Elder [[Runara]], a [[bronze dragon]] who often took the form of a [[human]].
